title: Add uploaded travel photos as page background images in suitable sections

requirements.text: Add the 3 user-uploaded images as static frontend assets and create optimized background variants suitable for full-width page backgrounds (desktop + mobile), stored under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.

quotes: set as back ground image with suitable places

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/generated/` contains the optimized background image files derived from the uploaded images.
Background variants are sized/cropped appropriately for wide screens and remain visually acceptable on mobile (no critical subjects cut off).
Image files are referenced directly from the frontend (no backend routing).

requirements.text: Apply the uploaded images as background images in suitable places across the app while preserving text readability: (1) use one image as the Home page hero section background with a dark/soft overlay, (2) use another image as a subtle header/hero background accent for the Hotels & Stays page, and (3) use the third image as a subtle background accent for the Sales Store page. Keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: set as back ground image with suitable places

acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero section renders with a background image and an overlay that keeps the headline and buttons clearly readable in both light and dark mode.
Hotels & Stays page includes a visually subtle background/hero accent image that does not reduce form/card readability.
Sales Store page includes a visually subtle background/hero accent image that does not reduce product/cart/checkout readability.
No user-facing text is changed to non-English while implementing these backgrounds.

requirements.text: Implement a reusable CSS pattern for background images (e.g., a wrapper class with `background-size: cover`, `background-position: center`, and an overlay layer), and apply it without modifying any files under `frontend/src/components/ui/*` or other immutable paths.

quotes: set as back ground image with suitable places

acceptanceCriteria: Background styling is implemented via app/page components and/or global CSS (e.g., `frontend/src/index.css`) without editing any immutable UI component sources.
Background images do not cause layout shift and do not break sticky header readability (header remains legible against the background).
Pages continue to render correctly with Tailwind and existing theme variables in both light and dark mode.

constraints: Use React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS; do not introduce other frontend frameworks.

Do not edit immutable frontend paths: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Store background images as static assets in `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and reference them from the frontend.
Backend must remain unchanged for this request (no Motoko changes required).
nonGoals: Implementing actual image upload or image management UI within the app.
Adding new routes, new modules, or changing any booking/order business logic.
Adding animations, carousels, or slideshow background rotation unless explicitly requested.
